relation: Hobday, Sr. Jose Maria, "Human Rights for Native Americans," Catholic Worker Friday Night Meeting, New York City, 17 October 1980. Cassette.
Hoinacki, Lee, "The Thought of Ivan Illich," Catholic Worker Friday Night Meeting, New York City, 22 February 1991. Cassette.
Holmer, Paul, "C.S. Lewis as Christian Teacher," Catholic Worker Friday Night Meeting, New York City, 11 January 1980. Cassette.
Hoey, Thomas, interviewed by Douglas Wright, 21 October 1978. 3 Cassettes (4 sides). Transcribed.
Holben, Larry. See: Los Angeles Catholic Worker Celebration, Cassettes I, II, and IV.
Holy Family House, Opal Blankinship Show, KPRS Radio, Kansas City, MO. Side 1: Interview of Srs. Teresa Horn-Bostel and Joan Kane, recorded 22 October 1984. Cassette.
Horn-Bostel, Sr. Teresa. See: Holy Family House.
Horvath, Patrick, "Faith Confronting the System  Legal Problems of the Poor," Catholic Worker Friday Night Meeting, New York City, 21 October 1988. Cassette.
"Housing and Hospitality," Catholic Worker Friday Night Meeting, New York City, 12 January 1979. Panel discussion with Peter Anagnostos, Meg Brodhead, and Kathleen Clarkson. 120 minute cassette.

Hoyt, Rev. Robert, talk on revolution, followed by discussion centering on acceptability of violence as means or tactic, Casa Maria House of Hospitality, Milwaukee, WI, 1968. 2 Cassettes (Side 1 of Cassette II). Also on reel-to-reel, Box 4.
